newsitem.title: MACAU: Macau crime rate up 19.4 percent in 1996 - govt.
newsitem.headline: Macau crime rate up 19.4 percent in 1996 - govt.

text.p: Macau saw a sharp 19.4 percent rise in its reported crime rate in 1996 compared with 1995, the Macau Statistics and Census department said on Monday.
A total of 8,576 crimes were reported 1996, or 23.4 cases a day, the department said.
The Portuguese-administered territory saw its number of births moving down 6.9 percent in 1996 to 5,468, compared to 1,413 deaths, up 4.6 against 1995.
The population stood at 454,800 at the end of 1996, up 7.1 percent versus 1995, giving the tiny territory on China's southern coast a population density of 21,650 persons per square kilometre.
